intro: Pimelea oreophila subsp. ephaistica, commonly known as the Narrow-leafed Heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and ecological importance in native plant communities.
